name: Avoid using deprecated properties of navigator object (Javascript)
description:
This rule will check the use of:

-navigator.userAgent
-navigator.appCodeName
-navigator.appVersion
-navigator.appName
-navigator.product
-navigator.platform
-navigator.vendor
-navigator.productSub
-navigator.vendorSub

These properties provide little to no useful information and can lead to incorrect feature detection, browser identification, or compatibility logic. Modern browsers have frozen or deprecated these values to prevent fingerprinting and improve user privacy.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
-navigator.userAgent: The User Agent string is frozen/unstable and the parsing is brittle
-navigator.appCodeName: Always returns the constant string "Mozilla", regardless of the actual browser
-navigator.appVersion: Returns an ambiguous substring of the userAgent string that can be misleading
-navigator.appName: Always returns "Netscape"
-navigator.product: Always returns the constant string "Gecko", regardless of the rendering engine
-navigator.platform: Simplified or spoofed due to privacy restrictions, making it unreliable for OS identification
-navigator.vendor: Returns unreliable fixed strings (e.g., "Google Inc.", "Apple Computer, Inc.", or empty string)
-navigator.productSub: Returns constant strings like "20030107" or "20100101" with no meaningful information
-navigator.vendorSub: Always returns an empty string ("")
reference:
CWE-477: Use of Obsolete Function
This CWE covers the use of deprecated or obsolete functions, methods, or APIs that may lead to security vulnerabilities, unreliable behavior, or maintenance issues.
alternativeName: Avoid using deprecated properties of navigator object (Javascript)

qualityStandards.name: Ensure all Systems and Software are Protected from Known Vulnerabilities
Ensure all Systems and Software are Protected from Known Vulnerabilities
An inventory of bespoke and custom software, and third-party software components incorporated into bespoke and custom software is maintained to facilitate vulnerability and patch management.
